title: NIH’s mental health chief on why he’s leaving for Google: Technology may hold key to better diagnosis
text:
09 NIH’s mental health chief on why he’s leaving for Google: Technology may hold key to better diagnosis 
The Washington Post: Thomas Insel, who has been director of the National Institute of Mental Health for 13 years, is leaving at the end of the month to join Google. A major force behind the Obama administration’s BRAIN Initiative, he stirred major controversy by pressing for an overhaul in the way mental illness is diagnosed. At Google, he’ll be exploring how the company’s technological expertise can be applied to mental-health issues.
